column4: Every image is provided with a proper alternative text
The page's source code begins with a Document Type Declaration (DTD) whose syntax is one of those recommended by the W3C
Each page's content is organised according to a hierarchical heading and sub-heading structure
The site forces no redirection or automatic refresh on the client side
Styling is not used to generate content
Dates are presented in an explicit format
The site provides at least one means of contact
Mail and phone information about local agencies or headquarters of companies and organisations are provided
Each page provides a title that enables one to identify its content
Information in regard to the right to copy and reuse are available from all pages
Advertisement or sponsored contents are identified as such
Each page provides a title that enables one to identify the site
Financing conditions (global credit cost, conditions, reservations, agreement delays) are indicated
Estimated delivery date is indicated before final order placement
Sale and use terms and conditions can be reached from every page
The legal registration number delivered to companies or organisations in their original country is indicated
The nature and quantifiable characteristics of products and services (dimensions, duration, countenance, etc.) are indicated
The availability of products is indicated before the final order submission
Prices displayed show the details of taxes and possible additional costs, as well as the price excluding taxes
The period and conditions of availability for special offers are indicated
Modifying each article's quantity, adding and deleting one or more articles is still possible as long as the order has not been definitely placed
The detailed subtotal (quantities, amount, expenses, insurance, etc.) is indicated before final order placement
Accepted payment means are indicated, as well as procedures for each of them
Conditions of guarantee (duration, options, extensions, prices, restrictions, etc.) are indicated
Customer support service conditions (prices, opening hours, means of contact, etc.) are indicated
Different shipping and billing addresses can be specified
Information about zones of product or service delivery are indicated
No additional product or service is added to the shopping cart without customer action
The site provides at least one means of contacting the moderator of public spaces
The length of video and audio contents is indicated
Sounds and videos are started by the user
The creation of a password by the user is validated by a double input
The format of downloadable files is  indicated
Animations, sounds and blinking can be paused
Each form field is associated with its own label in the source code
In the case when data entered in a form were rejected, the fields containing the rejected data are indicated to the user
Complex processes are provided with a list of steps
The current step in a process is indicated
The label of each form field indicates if input is mandatory
The page displayed after form submission must enable the user to navigate straight away
Each link has a proper label in the source code
Underlining cannot be used for other elements than hyperlinks
Hyperlinks are visually differentiated from the rest of the content
The identity of the person or of the service responsible for the contents is provided
The site's name and/or the author's name are provided on each page
The identity of the author, the company or the organisation is provided
The home page explains the nature of contents and services provided
If the site is restricted or destined to a specific public, this public is mentioned at least on the home page
Each page's source code specifies the content's main language
The country is mentioned in all post addresses
Each phone number is provided in an international format
The site does not use framesets
Iframes have an explicit title attribute
If all the pages in a site cannot be reached directly from the home page, then a site map can be reached from each page
Each page gives information as to where it is located in the site's hierarchy
It is possible to go back to the home page from any page
The site can be navigated in its entirety using only a keyboard
Keyboard focus is neither removed nor hidden
The user is warned when new windows have to be opened
Navigating the site does not open any popup window
The site does not contain any link to pages under construction
If all the pages in the site cannot be reached through the site map, then an internal search engine can be reached on each page
The site does not resize the browser window
An 'unsubscribe' link is provided in each newsletter
The “to” field in a newsletter shows only the recipient's address (or, alternatively, a generic email address created by the sender)
Subscribing to newsletters is subjected to a prior confirmation process
The design is consistent all over the site
The site provides a way to reinitialise a password if it's lost, stolen or forgotten
Sensitive data are securely transmitted and signalled as such
Sensitive data are not transmitted literally through URLs
Information relative to transaction security are provided
The identity of third-parties involved in transactions is provided
Security certificates are signed and currently valid
The privacy policy can be reached from any page
Headers sent by the server contain information pertaining to the character set used
The server sends information to enable the caching of contents
The address of the site and of its subdomains works with and without a www prefix
The server sends a personalised 404 Not found error page
The server sends a 404 HTTP error code for resources not found
The server compresses contents if the client accepts compressed contents
The source code of syndication feeds indicates their update frequency
Hyperlinks in syndication feeds are absolute
Syndication feeds can be detected by user agents
Cells in data tables are linked to their headers
Information are not conveyed by colour alone
Embedded objects are provided with a proper alternative
Audio captchas can be played again at will
The content does not include nested tables
The character encoding used is UTF-8
Text that can be designed through styles is not replaced by images
Words do not bear any internal space or markup
The site provides at least two means of contact
Every information request is met with an acknowledgement of receipt
Delays for replies to information requests are given
The site provides users with a way to know about new contents and services
Cryptic syntaxes (SMS language, ASCII art, etc.) are explained or translated
Elements which are presented visually as lists are tagged in an appropriate way in the source code
Navigation blocks are in a consistent place in the source code of all pages
The content and meaning of each page are not altered when styles are disabled
Each page's source code contains a metadata defining the character set used
Any affiliation to a professional association, endorsement of a label or an award features a link to its source
The way to solve litigations is indicated in the terms and conditions
Unavailable products are visually and textually differentiated
The site accepts at least two means of payment
An email indicating the transaction's reference and the content of the order is sent following order placement
The transaction reference is shown to the customer after the order has been placed
Debiting or cashing conditions are specified before final order placement
Opening hours and prices for all services made available to customers are indicated
Contents and files destined to public spaces can be checked before final upload
Conditions of moderation in public spaces are indicated
Public spaces provide at least one means of reporting abuse
The text of internal PDF documents can be selected
The size of files that can be downloaded on the site itself is indicated
Thumbnails are not bigger images that were resized on the client side
In the case when data entered in a form was rejected, the reasons for the rejection are indicated to the user
When a form spans several pages, a global summary is displayed before the final form submission
In the case when data entered in a form was rejected, all the data entered can be modified by the user
The submission of a form is followed by a feedback message indicating if the action worked or not
The label of each form field indicates if need be what input format must be used
Hyperlinks of the same nature have identical colours, shapes and behaviours on all pages
Hovering over, or activating, hyperlinks does not alter the layout
The site does not forbid incoming links
All hyperlinks internal to the site are valid
The site applies a different style to unvisited and visited links
The site's root contains instructions for spiders and robots
The source code for each page contains a metadata describing the page's content
The complete address and phone number of companies and organisations can be reached from each page of the site
The source code of the pages contains a valid call to a favourite icon (“favicon”)
The main language of a link's target page is provided if it differs from the original page
Each page provides a link to available translations
Navigation icons are provided with an explicit legend
Each page provides “skip links” at the beginning of its source code
The search result page indicates the number of results, the number of pages of results, and the number of results per page
Keyboard navigation happens in an foreseeable order
New windows that are resized, as well as modal windows, are provided with an explicit close button
Navigation blocks of the same nature are in a consistent place on every page
Links to an external software have an explicit label
If the site is not restricted to a specific public, content is available immediately
A content that must be read by a screen reader is not hidden from it
The site provides at least one print stylesheet
A generic font family is listed as the last alternative in font family lists
The display font size is set in variable units and not in fixed units
The server does not list files in folders that do not have index files
The aim of using cookies, as well as the consequences of refusing them, are explained
Accounts and subscriptions opened online can be closed online
The server sends the main language of contents as a header
Captions for data tables are provided
Passwords can be chosen and changed by the user
The process of accessing and modifying personal data is explained
The server sends a personalised 403 Not allowed error page
The site provides at least one link to each syndication feed
Linearising tables used for layout does not impede the understanding of contents
Data tables are not simulated through styled text
An alternative way is provided wherever captchas are used
Every audio or video content is provided with a text transcript
Inline styles are used in an appropriate way
The page's source code includes no error in either the tree of the document or the syntax of tags and attributes
Each page's source code does not contain any presentational tag or attribute
Real dimensions of images are indicated in the source code
The first occurrence of an abbreviation or of an acronym in the content of any page gives access to its meaning
Contents and services are available even if scripts are disabled
The page's source code is valid according to the chosen grammar
Quotations are tagged in an appropriate way in the source code
Each page's source code contains no element that was misused for presentational purposes
The data contained in the site's WHOIS information make it possible to get to the owner directly
Graphical symbols are HTML images and not unicode characters
A lexicon or a glossary adapted to the target audience explains the professional or technical vocabulary
The content of each page of a site contains no spelling mistake
If the site provides a personal space (or a subscriber space), it is possible to backup personal data in a standard format
A metadata indicates the reference URL for contents provided in several forms
The site provides at least one means of contacting the person to whom complaints can be placed
Refunding conditions (delays, expenses and vouchers needed) are indicated
The address and the conditions for returns (on site, to workshops) are indicated
Each complaint is met with an acknowledgement of receipt
The way to file complaints and the way they are processed are indicated
Information destined to public spaces can be previewed in their final presentation
Running animations does not block access to navigation or content
An information link is provided for each plugin necessary to access the content
Internal PDF documents are tagged
Form validation on the client side is also done on the server side
The user is told when a form input is case-sensitive
Each form label is visually linked to the form field it describes
Form fields that require a common information are grouped under a single legend
Elements of a drop-down list that can be grouped are indeed grouped in a proper way
Option lists in forms are presented in an understandable order
Consecutive hyperlinks are separated visually
Each hyperlink's label describes either its function or the nature of its target
Internal and external hyperlinks are differentiated
The extension used is coherent with the identity, the activity, the geographical zone or with the domain name
If the site claims to abide to on or more standards and guidelines, a link is provided to each of them
The site provides a sitemap file listing contents to be crawled
Links to equivalent versions of a page or site are written in the target language
Each language change is signalled
Links to translated versions directly target the current page's translation
The language of downloadable files is mentioned if it is not the same as the original page
The content's text direction is indicated when it differs from default
Navigating the site does not forcefully open any new window
It is possible to unsubscribe from newsletters from the site
The publication date and/or the issue number of the newsletter are indicated in the subject of messages
The latest newsletter sent is available online
The frequency of newsletters can be found before subscribing
Newsletter archives are available online
The amount of different fonts used on the site is less than or equal to three (except when showing works or graphic products)
Contents are presented with a sufficient contrast with their background
The content of each page can be printed without navigation blocks
The site provides one or more style sheets for mobile browsers
Sentences or groups of words in text images are not cut up in several images
A content is not mentioned only in reference to its shape or to its position on the screen
Text content can still be read when text is increased twice in the browser
Capitalisation of words for decorative purposes is achieved through styling
A mechanism raises the user's awareness regarding their password's level of security
The server respects the preferential order of languages specified in user agents
Calls to external scripts are put after the content
The main navigation menu is featured on personalised error pages
Script functions are put into external files
Scripts are minified
Style information are minified
